005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.AccumulatorResult;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.SPIJNI;
011import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
012import java.nio.ByteOrder;
013import java.nio.IntBuffer;
014
015/** Represents a SPI bus port. */
016public class SPI implements AutoCloseable {
017  public enum Port {
018    kOnboardCS0(0),
019    kOnboardCS1(1),
020    kOnboardCS2(2),
021    kOnboardCS3(3),
022    kMXP(4);
023
024    public final int value;
025
026    Port(int value) {
027      this.value = value;
028    }
029  }
030
031  private int m_port;
032  private int m_msbFirst;
033  private int m_clockIdleHigh;
034  private int m_sampleOnTrailing;
035
036  /**
037   * Constructor.
038   *
039   * @param port the physical SPI port
040   */
041  public SPI(Port port) {
042    m_port = (byte) port.value;
043
044    SPIJNI.spiInitialize(m_port);
045
046    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_SPI, port.value + 1);
047  }
048
049  public int getPort() {
050    return m_port;
051  }
052
053  @Override
054  public void close() {
055    if (m_accum != null) {
056      m_accum.close();
057      m_accum = null;
058    }
059    SPIJNI.spiClose(m_port);
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Configure the rate of the generated clock signal. The default value is 500,000 Hz. The maximum
064   * value is 4,000,000 Hz.
065   *
066   * @param hz The clock rate in Hertz.
067   */
068  public final void setClockRate(int hz) {
069    SPIJNI.spiSetSpeed(m_port, hz);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Configure the order that bits are sent and received on the wire to be most significant bit
074   * first.
075   */
076  public final void setMSBFirst() {
077    m_msbFirst = 1;
078    SPIJNI.spiSetOpts(m_port, m_msbFirst, m_sampleOnTrailing, m_clockIdleHigh);
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Configure the order that bits are sent and received on the wire to be least significant bit
083   * first.
084   */
085  public final void setLSBFirst() {
086    m_msbFirst = 0;
087    SPIJNI.spiSetOpts(m_port, m_msbFirst, m_sampleOnTrailing, m_clockIdleHigh);
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Configure the clock output line to be active low. This is sometimes called clock polarity high
092   * or clock idle high.
093   */
094  public final void setClockActiveLow() {
095    m_clockIdleHigh = 1;
096    SPIJNI.spiSetOpts(m_port, m_msbFirst, m_sampleOnTrailing, m_clockIdleHigh);
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Configure the clock output line to be active high. This is sometimes called clock polarity low
101   * or clock idle low.
102   */
103  public final void setClockActiveHigh() {
104    m_clockIdleHigh = 0;
105    SPIJNI.spiSetOpts(m_port, m_msbFirst, m_sampleOnTrailing, m_clockIdleHigh);
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Configure that the data is stable on the leading edge and the data changes on the trailing
110   * edge.
111   */
112  public final void setSampleDataOnLeadingEdge() {
113    m_sampleOnTrailing = 0;
114    SPIJNI.spiSetOpts(m_port, m_msbFirst, m_sampleOnTrailing, m_clockIdleHigh);
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Configure that the data is stable on the trailing edge and the data changes on the leading
119   * edge.
120   */
121  public final void setSampleDataOnTrailingEdge() {
122    m_sampleOnTrailing = 1;
123    SPIJNI.spiSetOpts(m_port, m_msbFirst, m_sampleOnTrailing, m_clockIdleHigh);
124  }
125
126  /** Configure the chip select line to be active high. */
127  public final void setChipSelectActiveHigh() {
128    SPIJNI.spiSetChipSelectActiveHigh(m_port);
129  }
130
131  /** Configure the chip select line to be active low. */
132  public final void setChipSelectActiveLow() {
133    SPIJNI.spiSetChipSelectActiveLow(m_port);
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Write data to the peripheral device. Blocks until there is space in the output FIFO.
138   *
139   * <p>If not running in output only mode, also saves the data received on the CIPO input during
140   * the transfer into the receive FIFO.
141   *
142   * @param dataToSend The buffer containing the data to send.
143   * @param size The number of bytes to send.
144   * @return Number of bytes written or -1 on error.
145   */
146  public int write(byte[] dataToSend, int size) {
147    if (dataToSend.length < size) {
148      throw new IllegalArgumentException("buffer is too small, must be at least " + size);
149    }
150    return SPIJNI.spiWriteB(m_port, dataToSend, (byte) size);
151  }
152
153  /**
154   * Write data to the peripheral device. Blocks until there is space in the output FIFO.
155   *
156   * <p>If not running in output only mode, also saves the data received on the CIPO input during
157   * the transfer into the receive FIFO.
158   *
159   * @param dataToSend The buffer containing the data to send.
160   * @param size The number of bytes to send.
161   * @return Number of bytes written or -1 on error.
162   */
163  @SuppressWarnings("ByteBufferBackingArray")
164  public int write(ByteBuffer dataToSend, int size) {
165    if (dataToSend.hasArray()) {
166      return write(dataToSend.array(), size);
167    }
168    if (!dataToSend.isDirect()) {
169      throw new IllegalArgumentException("must be a direct buffer");
170    }
171    if (dataToSend.capacity() < size) {
172      throw new IllegalArgumentException("buffer is too small, must be at least " + size);
173    }
174    return SPIJNI.spiWrite(m_port, dataToSend, (byte) size);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Read a word from the receive FIFO.
179   *
180   * <p>Waits for the current transfer to complete if the receive FIFO is empty.
181   *
182   * <p>If the receive FIFO is empty, there is no active transfer, and initiate is false, errors.
183   *
184   * @param initiate If true, this function pushes "0" into the transmit buffer and initiates a
185   *     transfer. If false, this function assumes that data is already in the receive FIFO from a
186   *     previous write.
187   * @param dataReceived Buffer in which to store bytes read.
188   * @param size Number of bytes to read.
189   * @return Number of bytes read or -1 on error.
190   */
191  public int read(boolean initiate, byte[] dataReceived, int size) {
192    if (dataReceived.length < size) {
193      throw new IllegalArgumentException("buffer is too small, must be at least " + size);
194    }
195    return SPIJNI.spiReadB(m_port, initiate, dataReceived, (byte) size);
196  }
197
198  /**
199   * Read a word from the receive FIFO.
200   *
201   * <p>Waits for the current transfer to complete if the receive FIFO is empty.
202   *
203   * <p>If the receive FIFO is empty, there is no active transfer, and initiate is false, errors.
204   *
205   * @param initiate If true, this function pushes "0" into the transmit buffer and initiates a
206   *     transfer. If false, this function assumes that data is already in the receive FIFO from a
207   *     previous write.
208   * @param dataReceived The buffer to be filled with the received data.
209   * @param size The length of the transaction, in bytes
210   * @return Number of bytes read or -1 on error.
211   */
212  @SuppressWarnings("ByteBufferBackingArray")
213  public int read(boolean initiate, ByteBuffer dataReceived, int size) {
214    if (dataReceived.hasArray()) {
215      return read(initiate, dataReceived.array(), size);
216    }
217    if (!dataReceived.isDirect()) {
218      throw new IllegalArgumentException("must be a direct buffer");
219    }
220    if (dataReceived.capacity() < size) {
221      throw new IllegalArgumentException("buffer is too small, must be at least " + size);
222    }
223    return SPIJNI.spiRead(m_port, initiate, dataReceived, (byte) size);
224  }
225
226  /**
227   * Perform a simultaneous read/write transaction with the device.
228   *
229   * @param dataToSend The data to be written out to the device
230   * @param dataReceived Buffer to receive data from the device
231   * @param size The length of the transaction, in bytes
232   * @return TODO
233   */
234  public int transaction(byte[] dataToSend, byte[] dataReceived, int size) {
235    if (dataToSend.length < size) {
236      throw new IllegalArgumentException("dataToSend is too small, must be at least " + size);
237    }
238    if (dataReceived.length < size) {
239      throw new IllegalArgumentException("dataReceived is too small, must be at least " + size);
240    }
241    return SPIJNI.spiTransactionB(m_port, dataToSend, dataReceived, (byte) size);
242  }
243
244  /**
245   * Perform a simultaneous read/write transaction with the device.
246   *
247   * @param dataToSend The data to be written out to the device.
248   * @param dataReceived Buffer to receive data from the device.
249   * @param size The length of the transaction, in bytes
250   * @return TODO
251   */
252  @SuppressWarnings("ByteBufferBackingArray")
253  public int transaction(ByteBuffer dataToSend, ByteBuffer dataReceived, int size) {
254    if (dataToSend.hasArray() && dataReceived.hasArray()) {
255      return transaction(dataToSend.array(), dataReceived.array(), size);
256    }
257    if (!dataToSend.isDirect()) {
258      throw new IllegalArgumentException("dataToSend must be a direct buffer");
259    }
260    if (dataToSend.capacity() < size) {
261      throw new IllegalArgumentException("dataToSend is too small, must be at least " + size);
262    }
263    if (!dataReceived.isDirect()) {
264      throw new IllegalArgumentException("dataReceived must be a direct buffer");
265    }
266    if (dataReceived.capacity() < size) {
267      throw new IllegalArgumentException("dataReceived is too small, must be at least " + size);
268    }
269    return SPIJNI.spiTransaction(m_port, dataToSend, dataReceived, (byte) size);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Initialize automatic SPI transfer engine.
274   *
275   * <p>Only a single engine is available, and use of it blocks use of all other chip select usage
276   * on the same physical SPI port while it is running.
277   *
278   * @param bufferSize buffer size in bytes
279   */
280  public void initAuto(int bufferSize) {
281    SPIJNI.spiInitAuto(m_port, bufferSize);
282  }
283
284  /** Frees the automatic SPI transfer engine. */
285  public void freeAuto() {
286    SPIJNI.spiFreeAuto(m_port);
287  }
288
289  /**
290   * Set the data to be transmitted by the engine.
291   *
292   * <p>Up to 16 bytes are configurable, and may be followed by up to 127 zero bytes.
293   *
294   * @param dataToSend data to send (maximum 16 bytes)
295   * @param zeroSize number of zeros to send after the data
296   */
297  public void setAutoTransmitData(byte[] dataToSend, int zeroSize) {
298    SPIJNI.spiSetAutoTransmitData(m_port, dataToSend, zeroSize);
299  }
300
301  /**
302   * Start running the automatic SPI transfer engine at a periodic rate.
303   *
304   * <p>{@link #initAuto(int)} and {@link #setAutoTransmitData(byte[], int)} must be called before
305   * calling this function.
306   *
307   * @param period period between transfers, in seconds (us resolution)
308   */
309  public void startAutoRate(double period) {
310    SPIJNI.spiStartAutoRate(m_port, period);
311  }
312
313  /**
314   * Start running the automatic SPI transfer engine when a trigger occurs.
315   *
316   * <p>{@link #initAuto(int)} and {@link #setAutoTransmitData(byte[], int)} must be called before
317   * calling this function.
318   *
319   * @param source digital source for the trigger (may be an analog trigger)
320   * @param rising trigger on the rising edge
321   * @param falling trigger on the falling edge
322   */
323  public void startAutoTrigger(DigitalSource source, boolean rising, boolean falling) {
324    SPIJNI.spiStartAutoTrigger(
325        m_port,
326        source.getPortHandleForRouting(),
327        source.getAnalogTriggerTypeForRouting(),
328        rising,
329        falling);
330  }
331
332  /** Stop running the automatic SPI transfer engine. */
333  public void stopAuto() {
334    SPIJNI.spiStopAuto(m_port);
335  }
336
337  /** Force the engine to make a single transfer. */
338  public void forceAutoRead() {
339    SPIJNI.spiForceAutoRead(m_port);
340  }
341
342  /**
343   * Read data that has been transferred by the automatic SPI transfer engine.
344   *
345   * <p>Transfers may be made a byte at a time, so it's necessary for the caller to handle cases
346   * where an entire transfer has not been completed.
347   *
348   * <p>Each received data sequence consists of a timestamp followed by the received data bytes, one
349   * byte per word (in the least significant byte). The length of each received data sequence is the
350   * same as the combined size of the data and zeroSize set in setAutoTransmitData().
351   *
352   * <p>Blocks until numToRead words have been read or timeout expires. May be called with
353   * numToRead=0 to retrieve how many words are available.
354   *
355   * @param buffer buffer where read words are stored
356   * @param numToRead number of words to read
357   * @param timeout timeout in seconds (ms resolution)
358   * @return Number of words remaining to be read
359   */
360  public int readAutoReceivedData(ByteBuffer buffer, int numToRead, double timeout) {
361    if (!buffer.isDirect()) {
362      throw new IllegalArgumentException("must be a direct buffer");
363    }
364    if (buffer.capacity() < numToRead * 4) {
365      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
366          "buffer is too small, must be at least " + (numToRead * 4));
367    }
368    return SPIJNI.spiReadAutoReceivedData(m_port, buffer, numToRead, timeout);
369  }
370
371  /**
372   * Read data that has been transferred by the automatic SPI transfer engine.
373   *
374   * <p>Transfers may be made a byte at a time, so it's necessary for the caller to handle cases
375   * where an entire transfer has not been completed.
376   *
377   * <p>Each received data sequence consists of a timestamp followed by the received data bytes, one
378   * byte per word (in the least significant byte). The length of each received data sequence is the
379   * same as the combined size of the data and zeroSize set in setAutoTransmitData().
380   *
381   * <p>Blocks until numToRead words have been read or timeout expires. May be called with
382   * numToRead=0 to retrieve how many words are available.
383   *
384   * @param buffer array where read words are stored
385   * @param numToRead number of words to read
386   * @param timeout timeout in seconds (ms resolution)
387   * @return Number of words remaining to be read
388   */
389  public int readAutoReceivedData(int[] buffer, int numToRead, double timeout) {
390    if (buffer.length < numToRead) {
391      throw new IllegalArgumentException("buffer is too small, must be at least " + numToRead);
392    }
393    return SPIJNI.spiReadAutoReceivedData(m_port, buffer, numToRead, timeout);
394  }
395
396  /**
397   * Get the number of bytes dropped by the automatic SPI transfer engine due to the receive buffer
398   * being full.
399   *
400   * @return Number of bytes dropped
401   */
402  public int getAutoDroppedCount() {
403    return SPIJNI.spiGetAutoDroppedCount(m_port);
404  }
405
406  /**
407   * Configure the Auto SPI Stall time between reads.
408   *
409   * @param csToSclkTicks the number of ticks to wait before asserting the cs pin
410   * @param stallTicks the number of ticks to stall for
411   * @param pow2BytesPerRead the number of bytes to read before stalling
412   */
413  public void configureAutoStall(int csToSclkTicks, int stallTicks, int pow2BytesPerRead) {
414    SPIJNI.spiConfigureAutoStall(m_port, csToSclkTicks, stallTicks, pow2BytesPerRead);
415  }
416
417  private static final int kAccumulateDepth = 2048;
418
419  private static class Accumulator implements AutoCloseable {
420    Accumulator(
421        int port,
422        int xferSize,
423        int validMask,
424        int validValue,
425        int dataShift,
426        int dataSize,
427        boolean isSigned,
428        boolean bigEndian) {
429      m_notifier = new Notifier(this::update);
430      m_buf =
431          ByteBuffer.allocateDirect((xferSize + 1) * kAccumulateDepth * 4)
432              .order(ByteOrder.nativeOrder());
433      m_intBuf = m_buf.asIntBuffer();
434      m_xferSize = xferSize + 1; // +1 for timestamp
435      m_validMask = validMask;
436      m_validValue = validValue;
437      m_dataShift = dataShift;
438      m_dataMax = 1 << dataSize;
439      m_dataMsbMask = 1 << (dataSize - 1);
440      m_isSigned = isSigned;
441      m_bigEndian = bigEndian;
442      m_port = port;
443    }
444
445    @Override
446    public void close() {
447      m_notifier.close();
448    }
449
450    final Notifier m_notifier;
451    final ByteBuffer m_buf;
452    final IntBuffer m_intBuf;
453    final Object m_mutex = new Object();
454
455    long m_value;
456    int m_count;
457    int m_lastValue;
458    long m_lastTimestamp;
459    double m_integratedValue;
460
461    int m_center;
462    int m_deadband;
463    double m_integratedCenter;
464
465    final int m_validMask;
466    final int m_validValue;
467    final int m_dataMax; // one more than max data value
468    final int m_dataMsbMask; // data field MSB mask (for signed)
469    final int m_dataShift; // data field shift right amount, in bits
470    final int m_xferSize; // SPI transfer size, in bytes
471    final boolean m_isSigned; // is data field signed?
472    final boolean m_bigEndian; // is response big endian?
473    final int m_port;
474
475    void update() {
476      synchronized (m_mutex) {
477        boolean done = false;
478        while (!done) {
479          done = true;
480
481          // get amount of data available
482          int numToRead = SPIJNI.spiReadAutoReceivedData(m_port, m_buf, 0, 0);
483
484          // only get whole responses
485          numToRead -= numToRead % m_xferSize;
486          if (numToRead > m_xferSize * kAccumulateDepth) {
487            numToRead = m_xferSize * kAccumulateDepth;
488            done = false;
489          }
490          if (numToRead == 0) {
491            return; // no samples
492          }
493
494          // read buffered data
495          SPIJNI.spiReadAutoReceivedData(m_port, m_buf, numToRead, 0);
496
497          // loop over all responses
498          for (int off = 0; off < numToRead; off += m_xferSize) {
499            // get timestamp from first word
500            long timestamp = m_intBuf.get(off) & 0xffffffffL;
501
502            // convert from bytes
503            int resp = 0;
504            if (m_bigEndian) {
505              for (int i = 1; i < m_xferSize; ++i) {
506                resp <<= 8;
507                resp |= m_intBuf.get(off + i) & 0xff;
508              }
509            } else {
510              for (int i = m_xferSize - 1; i >= 1; --i) {
511                resp <<= 8;
512                resp |= m_intBuf.get(off + i) & 0xff;
513              }
514            }
515
516            // process response
517            if ((resp & m_validMask) == m_validValue) {
518              // valid sensor data; extract data field
519              int data = resp >> m_dataShift;
520              data &= m_dataMax - 1;
521              // 2s complement conversion if signed MSB is set
522              if (m_isSigned && (data & m_dataMsbMask) != 0) {
523                data -= m_dataMax;
524              }
525              // center offset
526              int dataNoCenter = data;
527              data -= m_center;
528              // only accumulate if outside deadband
529              if (data < -m_deadband || data > m_deadband) {
530                m_value += data;
531                if (m_count != 0) {
532                  // timestamps use the 1us FPGA clock; also handle rollover
533                  if (timestamp >= m_lastTimestamp) {
534                    m_integratedValue +=
535                        dataNoCenter * (timestamp - m_lastTimestamp) * 1e-6 - m_integratedCenter;
536                  } else {
537                    m_integratedValue +=
538                        dataNoCenter * ((1L << 32) - m_lastTimestamp + timestamp) * 1e-6
539                            - m_integratedCenter;
540                  }
541                }
542              }
543              ++m_count;
544              m_lastValue = data;
545            } else {
546              // no data from the sensor; just clear the last value
547              m_lastValue = 0;
548            }
549            m_lastTimestamp = timestamp;
550          }
551        }
552      }
553    }
554  }
555
556  private Accumulator m_accum;
557
558  /**
559   * Initialize the accumulator.
560   *
561   * @param period Time between reads
562   * @param cmd SPI command to send to request data
563   * @param xferSize SPI transfer size, in bytes
564   * @param validMask Mask to apply to received data for validity checking
565   * @param validValue After validMask is applied, required matching value for validity checking
566   * @param dataShift Bit shift to apply to received data to get actual data value
567   * @param dataSize Size (in bits) of data field
568   * @param isSigned Is data field signed?
569   * @param bigEndian Is device big endian?
570   */
571  public void initAccumulator(
572      double period,
573      int cmd,
574      int xferSize,
575      int validMask,
576      int validValue,
577      int dataShift,
578      int dataSize,
579      boolean isSigned,
580      boolean bigEndian) {
581    initAuto(xferSize * 2048);
582    byte[] cmdBytes = new byte[] {0, 0, 0, 0};
583    if (bigEndian) {
584      for (int i = xferSize - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
585        cmdBytes[i] = (byte) (cmd & 0xff);
586        cmd >>= 8;
587      }
588    } else {
589      cmdBytes[0] = (byte) (cmd & 0xff);
590      cmd >>= 8;
591      cmdBytes[1] = (byte) (cmd & 0xff);
592      cmd >>= 8;
593      cmdBytes[2] = (byte) (cmd & 0xff);
594      cmd >>= 8;
595      cmdBytes[3] = (byte) (cmd & 0xff);
596    }
597    setAutoTransmitData(cmdBytes, xferSize - 4);
598    startAutoRate(period);
599
600    m_accum =
601        new Accumulator(
602            m_port, xferSize, validMask, validValue, dataShift, dataSize, isSigned, bigEndian);
603    m_accum.m_notifier.startPeriodic(period * 1024);
604  }
605
606  /** Frees the accumulator. */
607  public void freeAccumulator() {
608    if (m_accum != null) {
609      m_accum.close();
610      m_accum = null;
611    }
612    freeAuto();
613  }
614
615  /** Resets the accumulator to zero. */
616  public void resetAccumulator() {
617    if (m_accum == null) {
618      return;
619    }
620    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
621      m_accum.m_value = 0;
622      m_accum.m_count = 0;
623      m_accum.m_lastValue = 0;
624      m_accum.m_lastTimestamp = 0;
625      m_accum.m_integratedValue = 0;
626    }
627  }
628
629  /**
630   * Set the center value of the accumulator.
631   *
632   * <p>The center value is subtracted from each value before it is added to the accumulator. This
633   * is used for the center value of devices like gyros and accelerometers to make integration work
634   * and to take the device offset into account when integrating.
635   *
636   * @param center The accumulator's center value.
637   */
638  public void setAccumulatorCenter(int center) {
639    if (m_accum == null) {
640      return;
641    }
642    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
643      m_accum.m_center = center;
644    }
645  }
646
647  /**
648   * Set the accumulator's deadband.
649   *
650   * @param deadband The accumulator's deadband.
651   */
652  public void setAccumulatorDeadband(int deadband) {
653    if (m_accum == null) {
654      return;
655    }
656    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
657      m_accum.m_deadband = deadband;
658    }
659  }
660
661  /**
662   * Read the last value read by the accumulator engine.
663   *
664   * @return The last value read by the accumulator engine.
665   */
666  public int getAccumulatorLastValue() {
667    if (m_accum == null) {
668      return 0;
669    }
670    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
671      m_accum.update();
672      return m_accum.m_lastValue;
673    }
674  }
675
676  /**
677   * Read the accumulated value.
678   *
679   * @return The 64-bit value accumulated since the last Reset().
680   */
681  public long getAccumulatorValue() {
682    if (m_accum == null) {
683      return 0;
684    }
685    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
686      m_accum.update();
687      return m_accum.m_value;
688    }
689  }
690
691  /**
692   * Read the number of accumulated values.
693   *
694   * <p>Read the count of the accumulated values since the accumulator was last Reset().
695   *
696   * @return The number of times samples from the channel were accumulated.
697   */
698  public int getAccumulatorCount() {
699    if (m_accum == null) {
700      return 0;
701    }
702    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
703      m_accum.update();
704      return m_accum.m_count;
705    }
706  }
707
708  /**
709   * Read the average of the accumulated value.
710   *
711   * @return The accumulated average value (value / count).
712   */
713  public double getAccumulatorAverage() {
714    if (m_accum == null) {
715      return 0;
716    }
717    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
718      m_accum.update();
719      if (m_accum.m_count == 0) {
720        return 0.0;
721      }
722      return ((double) m_accum.m_value) / m_accum.m_count;
723    }
724  }
725
726  /**
727   * Read the accumulated value and the number of accumulated values atomically.
728   *
729   * <p>This function reads the value and count atomically. This can be used for averaging.
730   *
731   * @param result AccumulatorResult object to store the results in.
732   */
733  public void getAccumulatorOutput(AccumulatorResult result) {
734    if (result == null) {
735      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Null parameter `result'");
736    }
737    if (m_accum == null) {
738      result.value = 0;
739      result.count = 0;
740      return;
741    }
742    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
743      m_accum.update();
744      result.value = m_accum.m_value;
745      result.count = m_accum.m_count;
746    }
747  }
748
749  /**
750   * Set the center value of the accumulator integrator.
751   *
752   * <p>The center value is subtracted from each value*dt before it is added to the integrated
753   * value. This is used for the center value of devices like gyros and accelerometers to take the
754   * device offset into account when integrating.
755   *
756   * @param center The accumulator integrator's center value.
757   */
758  public void setAccumulatorIntegratedCenter(double center) {
759    if (m_accum == null) {
760      return;
761    }
762    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
763      m_accum.m_integratedCenter = center;
764    }
765  }
766
767  /**
768   * Read the integrated value. This is the sum of (each value * time between values).
769   *
770   * @return The integrated value accumulated since the last Reset().
771   */
772  public double getAccumulatorIntegratedValue() {
773    if (m_accum == null) {
774      return 0;
775    }
776    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
777      m_accum.update();
778      return m_accum.m_integratedValue;
779    }
780  }
781
782  /**
783   * Read the average of the integrated value. This is the sum of (each value times the time between
784   * values), divided by the count.
785   *
786   * @return The average of the integrated value accumulated since the last Reset().
787   */
788  public double getAccumulatorIntegratedAverage() {
789    if (m_accum == null) {
790      return 0;
791    }
792    synchronized (m_accum.m_mutex) {
793      m_accum.update();
794      if (m_accum.m_count <= 1) {
795        return 0.0;
796      }
797      // count-1 due to not integrating the first value received
798      return m_accum.m_integratedValue / (m_accum.m_count - 1);
799    }
800  }
801}
